text: When trying to run the GET core task with a non-standard http source port (ex: <get src="http://test.com:7925/services/" dest="index.html" /> ) a FileNotFoundException is thrown.  The URL is accessible through a browser on the same machine.
creator: jeffl8n@gmail.com

text: This appears to be an issue with java.net.URLConnection handling the http data over a non-standard port.  Using a packet sniffer (WireShark), I was able to see that the connection was made and the page was correctly returned over the TCP connection.
creator: jeffl8n@gmail.com
bodewig@apache.org
text:
Since Ant uses java.net in Get (and switching to something more sane like
Apache Httpclient would be a pretty big change) there isn't much we can do
from ant's side, can we?
Closing the bug ticket since this appears to be a Java issue and not with the Ant code.
creator: jeffl8n@gmail.com
